"I'll make no illusions, Rodimus," Devilcat says, taking a seat 
himself.  "The goal of the Rogues is regime change by any means 
necessary.  New thinking is needed to carry Cybertron into the 
future - not the beaurocratic babble of the Maximal Elders or the 
militarism of the Tripredacus Council.  That being said, my followers 
and I, if there were no other choice, would certainly prefer the 
former."  He leans forward to emphasize his point.  "The Tripred ship 
is state of the art, its crew likely elite warriors.  They're after 
something specific on this planet.  Taking reputations into account, 
the three biggest targets here are you, myself, and Hydras in no 
particular order.  If we continue to fight among ourselves, the 
Tripreds will pick us off at their lesiure.  That leaves us little in 
the line of options, wouldn't you say?"

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil sat, his massive form taking a lot of place at the table.
> 
> Yggdrasil: I arrived some times ago and was offered shelter by the
> Rogues. After the battle that took place here, Devilcat and his crew
> determined that the Tripredacus were a dangerous threat. Devilcat?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, RoboRick007 <rfa007@c...> wrote:
> > 
> > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > 
> > Rodimus shot a quick look back at Yggdrasil, before entering his
> office. Debriefing happens after a mission when you are being 
relieved
> of your duties. The mission on Earth was far from over and if the 
Iron
> Squad thinks that they will relieve Rodimus and take over the
> Maximals, they have another thing coming.
> > 
> > Rodimus sits in his chair behind a desk.
> > 
> > Rodimus Prime: Please both of you, sit down, and speak your mind.
